titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Anne Harney

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:25-0400

did.abstract: This correspondence is principally concerned with business between Pershouse and his brother James in England, with comments on conditions and events in the United States, including anti-British feeling, Thomas Paine's return to America, Jefferson's administration, and immigration. The papers include Pershouse's journal (1800-1838), which includes accounts of travels in England, France, and the United States, letterbooks (1836-1862) of Henry Pershouse, nephew of John, chiefly on business matters, and two volumes of Pershouse genealogical data, compiled by B.M. Pershouse Bayley (1899).

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: This collection contains five volumes of data relating to John Pershouse and his family. The collection contains two volumes of genealogical data from the later eighteenth century; the remaining three volumes all date to the early republic and consist of a travel journal and two letter books thought to belong to his nephew Henry. Of particular interest are the letters from Pershouse in Philadelphia to his brother in England. His letters often discuss many of the major political and social events happening in the early republic. He discusses immigration, Jeffersonâ€™s administration, and the culture of Philadelphia during this period.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies note
altformavail.p: This material is also available on microfilm (Film 1370).

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: John Pershouse was a Philadelphia merchant.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D. 62 letters and documents and 5 ms. vols. Various sizes. Letters and documents are individually catalogued; 1794-1841. Vols.are: (John Pershouse. Journal; Feb. 1800-1838: B.M.P.Bayley. Genealogical data of the Pershouse family; 1899 and H. Pershouse. Letterbooks; 1836-1862.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Manchester, A.L.S. 1p.and add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Concerning the possible sale of land.

did.unittitle: Letter to James Pershouse, Chorley, Lancashire;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Nuremberg, A.L. 3p.and add.,end. Mutilated. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Concerning his travels in Europe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 3p.and add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Ships flour. Concerning the price of provisions in England. Concerning Jefferson as president. Concerning political news in England. Concerning Pitt.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Concerning the price of food in England and the need for care of land. Concerning his travels in the U.S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Concerning internal affairs in the U.S. Concerning English foreign affairs. Concerning vaccination in the U.S. Immigration to the U.S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Internal affairs and prosperity of the U.S. Value of land in England. Current events. Refers to Porcupine, Franklin and Paine. Business in the U.S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S.with initials. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Will stay longer in the U.S. Friendly advice on going into trade. Concerning congress and Jefferson. Refers to the Indians. Growth of cotton in the U.S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Concerning some immigrants who return to England. State of commerce in the U.S. Hatred between North and South and fear that France, in Louisiana, will take the West, forecasts dissolution of the U.S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: New York, A.L. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Concerning his travels through New York state. Concerning T. Paine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business. Concerning the French in Louisiana and Jefferson. Refers to Paine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 1p. Copy. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business. On same sheet as letter from John Pershouse to James Pershouse; Jan. 1, 1803.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 3p.and add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters. . .) Concerning Paine and his coming to the U.S. Refers to Whitefield and Priestley. Business.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S.with initials. 3p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters.) Business. On same sheet is letter from John Pershouse to James Pershouse; Dec. 28, 1802.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,and.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business. Concerning Louisiana and the West. Refers to Paine and Jefferson. Priestley given dinner by the APS.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 2p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business. Swiss immigrantion to the U.S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Germantown, A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Yellow fever in Philadelphia. Business. Recommends he immigrate to the U.S. Concerning Jerome Bonaparte and T. Paine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business. Results of the yellow fever epidemic. Slaves in the U.S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business. Concerning internal improvements (roads and canals) of the U.S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S.with initials. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business. Revival of slave trade in the U.S. Current events. Refers to T. Jefferson. Jerome Bonaparte's marriage.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Praises the U.S. and urges him to immigrate. Refers to Jerome Bonaparte. Refers to Jefferson and Paine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Friendly letter. Concerning Jerome Bonaparte. Influx of immigrants. Will become a citizen. Refers to Priestley.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 3p.and add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business. Concerning a trip in Pennsylvania. Refers to Priestley.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 3p.and add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business. Will stay in America. Concerning Paine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Concerning T. Paine. Business. Concerning yellow fever. Current events.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business. Jefferson's speech to congress. Refers to T. Paine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 2p.and add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business. Rising feeling against impressment in the U.S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 3p.and add.,end. Contains pencilled note in German on add. sheet. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Sends gift of flour. Concerning T. Paine. Business. Growth of population in the U.S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business. Concerning immigration to the U.S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 2p.add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business. Refers to Jefferson. Concerning business in the U.S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 3p.and add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business. Friendly letter. Refers to an article in the Port Folio.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 2p. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business. Friendly letter. Concerning Thomas Paine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add., end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business. Concerning the Chesapeake and the Leopard affair. Refers to Jefferson. Concerning a comet.

scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business. Concerning Anglo-American relations.

scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business. Concerning the Embargo.

scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Current events. Describes expanding economy of the U.S. Death of Paine. Business.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business. Describes trip through Albany to Canada.

scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 3p.and. add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Describes how a poor man may prosper in the U.S. Business. Concerning Dunkers. Concerning Indians of Canada.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 3p.and add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Concerning immigration to the U.S. Business. Describes a visit to Maryland. Current events.

scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business. Development of manufactures in the U.S.

scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Concerning the war. Possible rise of manufactures in the U.S.

scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Concerning the war. Concerning internal affairs of the U.S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 3p.and add. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Concerning the peace and the development of the U.S. His plans to return to England.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S.with initials. 4p.,add. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Business. Returns soon to England. Growth of the U.S. Return of Bonaparte.

scopecontent.p: London, A.L.S. 1p.and add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Is in England and will visit him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 3p. and add.with P.S. by J[ames] Pershouse. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Friendly letter.

scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 3p. and add. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, L. 1p. Copy. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Advises mode of settling John Pershouse's estate. On same sheet as letter from R.Ewing to H.Pershouse; June 11, 1841.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 2p.and add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters. . .) Death of John Pershouse. Statement of John Pershouse's estate. Enclose copy of letter advising mode of settling the estate. On same sheet is copy of letter from J. Bayard to R. Ewing; June 4, 1841.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 1p.and add.,end. (see John Pershouse. Letters...) Concerning the settlement of John Pershouse's estate.

did.unittitle: Decision concerning the will of James Taylor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D.S.: Geo[rge] Goslling, Nath[anie]l Goslling and R.C.Cresswell, Deputy Registers. 1p. Stamped. Parchment. (see John Pershouse. Letter...)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.D.S. 128p. of which 70 contain writing. End.: Henry Pershouse and G.H. Bradney Pershouse. Contains entries of his travels in the U.S.

did.unittitle: Genealogical data of the Pershouse family

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.D.S. 2 vols. Contains references to John and James Pershouse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 2 volumes. Vol. 1 contains comments on books which he read, dated: 1834-1837. Vol. 2 contains entry on death of John Pershouse. Letters are mostly business letters.
